meanings.definition: Officially recognized as being trained or skilled in a particular job or activity.
meanings.sent1: She is a qualified nurse who helps sick people.
meanings.sent2: The qualified teacher knew how to explain difficult concepts clearly.
meanings.sent3: The qualified chef accidentally added too much salt to the soup.
meanings.sent4: His qualified expertise in gardening made his backyard a paradise.
meanings.sent5: The qualified pilot safely landed the plane in stormy weather.

meanings.definition: Limited or restricted in some way; not absolute.
meanings.sent1: He felt qualified to speak only about the topic he studied.
meanings.sent2: The qualified offer was valid for a limited time only.
meanings.sent3: The qualified access code allowed entry to certain rooms only.
meanings.sent4: Her qualified approval meant the project could proceed with changes.
meanings.sent5: The qualified warranty covered only specific parts of the product.

meanings.definition: Having the necessary skills or knowledge to do a particular job or task.
meanings.sent1: The qualified mechanic fixed the car quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent2: She felt qualified to take on the leadership role in the team.
meanings.sent3: The qualified student aced the test without studying.
meanings.sent4: His qualified understanding of technology impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The qualified doctor diagnosed the illness accurately and prescribed the right treatment.
